item.title: Correct ip ban?
item.dc:creator: @bhpkyeah satesql
item.description:
@bhpkyeah wrote:

thats because you have to tell the ip ban txt logs to save that information.

Add a method in the socket …
When you start your server let the connectedhost that are IPbanned load to an arraylist

ArrayList<Integer> IpBan = new ArrayList<Integer>();

In server.java

In client.java make a method that loads the hosts off a txt and add to the arraylist

IpBan.add(connectingHost);

In server.java add in socket

if(IpBan.contains(ConnectingHost)) { returnCode = 4; disconnected = true; } else { // Join server socket }

Make sure you got

import java.util.*;

Imported in server.java for the ArrayList package

Read full topic

item.title: Correct ip ban?
item.dc:creator: @pascal20 pascal20
item.description:
@pascal20 wrote:

mine kicks also only need one also i use

if (command.startsWith(“ipban”) && (playerRights >= 2)) {
try {
String banned = command.substring(6);
int name = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(banned);
client b = (client) server.playerHandler.players[name];
b.disconnected = true;
appendToIPBanned(b.connectedFrom);
PlayerHandler.messageToAll = (""+playerName+" has ip banned ["+b.connectedFrom+"] ("+command.substring(6)+")");
sendMessage(“You have ip banned “+command.substring(6)+”. Connected From: “+b.connectedFrom+””);
} catch(Exception e) {
sendMessage(""+command.substring(6)+" is either offline or name doesnt exist.");
}
BufferedWriter bw = null;
try {
bw = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter(“data/bannedips.txt”, true));
bw.write(""+playerName+" IP Banned “+command.substring(6)+”");
bw.newLine();
bw.flush();
} catch (IOException ioe) {
ioe.printStackTrace();
} finally {
if (bw != null) try {
bw.close();
} catch (IOException ioe2) {
sendMessage(“Error ipbanning user.”);
}
}
}

didntwork
